intro: Sutera virgulosa, commonly known as the silverleaf suture, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Sutera virgulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
